result.execSummary:
The defendant Derick D Bostick Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (<=1g), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Imposed and Stayed. Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 5 years bifurcated sentence.
Conditions, if revoked, are as outlined in probation conditions.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment OR attend school full-time, may be a combination of both to equal 40 hours per week.
No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.
No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Comply with AODA programming. Pay ZCI fees. Firearm warning given. Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

timeConds.notes: STAYED. Credit for time served only to be applied if revoked.

Comply with AODA programming. Pay ZCI fees. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Derick D Bostick Jr

records.addlTxt: Defendant has completed the Earned Release Program and balance of time is converted to Extended Supervision.
DOC-Notice of Case Status change - revoked - sentenced to prison.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: AMENDED 05-12-2016:  Length of probation term amended to one year for Ct. 4
From DOC re: probationary term for Ct. 4

Defendant Derick D Bostick in court with attorney Michelle Marie Anderson.  Dirk Christian Jensen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
BTC: 
Count 2- 5 Years WPS, 2 Years init, 3 Years es, i/s, 3 Years Probation

Count 4- 9 Months RCJ, i/s, 2 Years Probation, to run concurrent to count 2

Conditions:
90 days RCJ - STAYED in count 2
Comply with AODA programming
No drugs, no alcohol
Obtain & maintain full time employment & school or combination of both
Pay ZCI fees
Provide a DNA Sample + pay surcharge on count 2 only 
Court costs on count 2, waive cc on count 4
FAW
VOTE
Eligible for ERP & CIP
Credit for time served to be applied if revoked

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

**AMENDED 2/15/2016 Placed on house arrest with GPS monitoring. May only leave the house for court, medical appointments and for treatment must give proof to ZCI. No contact with C. I. No one is allowed over to the house unless approved by mother.

Defendant Derick D Bostick in court with attorney Michelle Marie Anderson.  Defendant Derick D Bostick in custody.  Dirk Christian Jensen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
St- Plea to count 2 & count 4; DRI the balance.
Rights Given
P- Guilty
BTC: Finding of guilt on count 2 & count 4; DRI the balance. Order PSI.
Def- Request the bond be modified to a lower amount of cash.
St- Objects to any bond modification.
BTC: Bond modification granted to $1,000 cash. Placed on house arrest with GPS monitoring, may only leave for court, medical appointements and for treatment must give proof to ZCI. No drugs no alcohol with ZCI to monitor. No contact with CI. No one is allowed over to the house unless approved by mother.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 29, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Derick D Bostick in court with attorney Michelle Marie Anderson.  Defendant Derick D Bostick in custody.  Dirk Christian Jensen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
Def- Request the trial date remain on the calendar but also requesting a status date as there was just a new offer given and would like some time to discuss it. Also requesting the bond be modified to $1,500 cash.
St- Objects to any bond modification.
BTC: Bond modification denied.  Status conference scheduled for February 15, 2016 at 09:00 am.
ATTY Anderson files motion for bond reduction
Status conference scheduled for January 22, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Derick D Bostick in court with attorney Michelle Marie Anderson.  Defendant Derick D Bostick in custody.  Antoinette L. Rich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Darlene Shue.
Def req bond mod.
State objects.
BTC:  Bond mod denied.

Defendant Derick D Bostick in court with attorney Erin Larsen for Atty Michelle Marie Anderson.  Defendant Derick D Bostick in custody.  W Richard Chiapete appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.
Defense requests bond modification. 
State objects to bond modification. 
BTC: Bond modification is denied.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 4, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
